page.title: 17THE LIBRARY, RHYL
page.content: The Carnegie Free library in Rhyl opened on 4th April, 1907, in the Town Hall. Mr. Andrew Carnegie, an American multi-millionaire of Scottish origin, gave Â£3,000 towards the Library's cost after an application was made to the Carnegie Trust by Rhyl Council. The Library was in the Town Hall from 1907 until 1982. Around the 1920s the Library changed from the Carnegie Free Library to the Rhyl Municipal Library and was run by the local borough. In 1974 the library system was under reorganisation and Rhyl Municipal Library now came under Clwyd County Council Library Service with the main headquarters in Shire Hall, Mold. At present the Library is temporarily housed at Morfa Hall awaiting the new Library and Museum complex, due to be completed by March, 1986. The new library will be fully computerized.
